item.title: System Startup
item.description: The boot process In linux, the boot process occurs when initiating the system. It goes from the moment the computer is powered on until the UI is fully operational and ready. This is a sequential Process 1. BIOS Basic Input Output System Initializes the hardware (including monitor and keyboard) Tests the main memory Normally installed in a ROM in the motherboard 2. Boot Loader & Kernel First Stage: Master Boot Record (MBR) examines the partition table and finds a bootable partition.
